result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D. Jacobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Contact with minors only at agent's discretion.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry. 
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Thirty (30) days with work release privileges.

OR 

Twenty (20) days WITHOUT work release privileges.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D. Jacobs

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Mackenzie Renner. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea count #1. Minutes filed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Reddy after August 1, 2022.

Defendant Joshua D. Jacobs appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Joshua D. Jacobs. Called @ 1:34 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference. Speedy demand for trial made on June 20, 2022. Record by Atty. Renner as to new offer but needs to go over it with her client. Clerk asks if speedy demand remains in place. Response by Atty. that speedy demand is still demanded at this time. Response by the Court who sets matter for trial in case it does not resolve.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in court in custody via video with Mackenzie Renner. DDA Sempf appears for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by defense denied. State objects to modifying bond. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:11 PM (64-06) Defendant Joshua D. Jacobs appeared by video.  Attorney Danne in court for Mackenzie Renner in court for Joshua D. Jacobs.  Attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Daane acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.


Adj. 2:14PM
Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua D. Jacobs in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant does qualify for SPD. SPD needs time to appoint. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua D. Jacobs in court, in custody by video. Attorney Grace Haggerman appears for bond purposes only. Bond rmains. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.  Complaint read by Court. Bond set over the weekend. Defendant fiance's mother is present in court and states defendant can live with them. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant must comply with sex offender registry. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
